Size: Climbing up to 4 m over supporting vegetation.
Flowers: Solitary, white or pink-tinged, 4-6 cm long and trumpet shaped. With two bracts clasping the base.
FruitSeeds: Capsule oval shaped to almost circular, up to 8 mm across with black seeds.
Habitat: This is a native plant to southeastern Australia. It inhabits riparian areas, wet forests, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Non-native Giant bindweed (*Calystegia silvatica*) is generally larger and has much larger bracts at the base of the flower.
Impacts: Note - this is a native plant.
